definitions.definition: To hire (somebody for work or a job).
definitions.example: Yesterday our local garage employed a new mechanic.

definitions.definition: To use (somebody for a job, or something for a task).
definitions.example: The burglar employed a jemmy to get in.

definitions.definition: To make busy.
A spherically contained volume of air or other gas, especially one made from soapy liquid.
A small spherical cavity in a solid material.
definitions.example: bubbles in window glass, or in a lens

definitions.definition: (by extension) Anything resembling a hollow sphere.
Anything lacking firmness or solidity; a cheat or fraud; an empty project.
A period of intense speculation in a market, causing prices to rise quickly to irrational levels as the metaphorical bubble expands, and then fall even more quickly as the bubble bursts.
definitions.example: dot-com bubble

definitions.definition: The emotional and/or physical atmosphere in which the subject is immersed.
An officer's station in a prison dormitory, affording views on all sides.
Someone who has been ‘bubbled’ or fooled; a dupe.
A small, hollow, floating bead or globe, formerly used for testing the strength of spirits.
The globule of air in the chamber of a spirit level.
A laugh.
definitions.example: Are you having a bubble?!

definitions.definition: A Greek.
Any of the small magnetized areas that make up bubble memory.

The point in a poker tournament when the last player without a prize loses all their chips and leaves the game, leaving only players that are going to win prizes. (e.g., if the last remaining 9 players win prizes, then the point when the 10th player leaves the tournament)
definitions.example: Many players tend to play timidly (not play many hands) around the bubble, to keep their chips and last longer in the game.

definitions.definition: A group of people who are in quarantine together.
Sparkling wine; champagne.
To produce bubbles, to rise up in bubbles (such as in foods cooking or liquids boiling).
To churn or foment, as if wishing to rise to the surface.
definitions.example: Rage bubbled inside him.

definitions.definition: To rise through a medium or system, similar to the way that bubbles rise in liquid.
To cheat, delude.
To cry, weep.
To pat a baby on the back so as to cause it to belch.
To cause to feel as if bubbling or churning.
To express in a bubbly or lively manner.
To form into a protruding round shape.
To cover with bubbles.
To bubble in; to mark a response on a form by filling in a circular area (‘bubble’).
One who pitches anything, as hay, quoits, a ball, etc.
, the player who delivers the ball to the batter.
The top partner in a homosexual relationship or penetrator in a sexual encounter between two men.
A sort of crowbar for digging.
A wide-mouthed, deep vessel for holding liquids, with a spout or protruding lip and a handle; a water jug or jar with a large ear or handle.
A tubular or cuplike appendage or expansion of the leaves of certain plants. See pitcher plant.
A representation of anything (as a person, a landscape, a building) upon canvas, paper, or other surface, by drawing, painting, printing, photography, etc.
An image; a representation as in the imagination.
A painting.
definitions.example: There was a picture hanging above the fireplace.

definitions.definition: A photograph.
definitions.example: I took a picture of the church.

definitions.definition: A motion picture.
definitions.example: Casablanca is my all-time favorite picture.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) ("the pictures") Cinema (as a form of entertainment).
definitions.example: Let's go to the pictures.

definitions.definition: A paragon, a perfect example or specimen (of a category).
definitions.example: She's the very picture of health.

definitions.definition: An attractive sight.
definitions.example: The garden is a real picture at this time of year.

definitions.definition: The art of painting; representation by painting.
A figure; a model.
Situation.
definitions.example: The employment picture for the older middle class is not so good.

definitions.definition: To wait in expectation of some event; to make ready.
definitions.example: Please stand by for more instructions.

definitions.definition: To remain loyal or faithful to.
definitions.example: Even though money is scarce sometimes, Ann stands by her decision to be a full-time mother.

definitions.definition: To support; to continue to support despite things being bad.
definitions.example: They stood by us all along and it's awesome to see them out here to support us today.

definitions.definition: To do nothing. To be inactive in a situation.
definitions.example: I can't simply stand by and watch you ruin your life.

definitions.definition: To be ready to provide assistance if required.
definitions.example: The tug stood by in case it was needed.

definitions.definition: A state of readiness without immediate involvement; remaining in preparation for (a sudden or unforeseen event or situation).
definitions.example: The troops were on standby in case of an attack.

definitions.definition: Sleep mode
(travel) Waiting at the airport in the hope of getting a seat on a flight that is already booked out.
Something that is standard, well-tested, or frequently used.
definitions.example: That recipe is an old standby, and she keeps the ingredients around in case of unexpected guests.

definitions.definition: The act of judging.
The power or faculty of performing such operations; especially, when unqualified, the faculty of judging or deciding rightly, justly, or wisely
definitions.example: a man of judgment

definitions.definition: The conclusion or result of judging; an opinion; a decision.
The act of determining, as in courts of law, what is conformable to law and justice; also, the determination, decision, or sentence of a court, or of a judge.
The final award; the last sentence.
Of, relating to, or connected with muscles.
Brawny, thewy, having strength.
Having large, well-developed muscles.
Robust, strong.
A recurring or dominant element; a theme.
definitions.example: See how the artist repeats the scroll motif throughout the work?

definitions.definition: A short melodic passage that is repeated in several parts of a work.
A decorative figure that is repeated in a design or pattern.
A decorative appliqué design or figure, as of lace or velvet, used in trimming.
The physical object or objects repeated at each point of a lattice. Usually atoms or molecules.
A basic element of a move in terms of why the piece moves and how it supports the fulfilment of a stipulation.
In a nucleotide or amino-acid sequence, pattern that is widespread and has, or is conjectured to have, a biological significance.
An instance of a disease or poor health.
definitions.example: Her grandmother had passed away after a long illness.

definitions.definition: A state of bad health or disease.
definitions.example: Many working days this year have been lost through illness.

definitions.definition: The fruit and its tree.
Extended senses.
Of a dark bluish-red colour.
Choice; especially lavish or preferred.
definitions.example: She landed a plum position as an executive for the firm.

definitions.definition: Plumb
To plumb.
Completely; utterly.
definitions.example: You're going to think I'm plum crazy for this, but I want to adopt all seven kittens.

definitions.definition: A large room, especially one used to receive and entertain guests.
A gathering of people for a social or intellectual meeting.
An art gallery or exhibition; especially the Paris salon or autumn salon.
A beauty salon or similar establishment.
A tavern, especially in an American Old West setting.
A lounge bar in an English public house, contrasted with the public bar.
definitions.example: A pint of beer in the saloon bar costs a penny more than in the public bar.

definitions.definition: The most common body style for modern cars, with a boot or trunk.
The cabin area of a boat or yacht devoted to seated relaxation, often combined with dining table.
The part of a rail carriage or multiple unit containing seating for passengers.
A prediction, especially one made by a prophet or under divine inspiration.

definitions.definition: The public interpretation of Scripture.
To speak or write with divine inspiration; to act as prophet.
To predict, to foretell (with or without divine inspiration).
To foreshow; to herald; to prefigure.
To speak out on the Bible as an expression of holy inspiration; to preach.
(except in derivatives) air, the air; the sky, the heavens.
An attic or similar space (often used for storage) in the roof of a house or other building.
The thickness of a soft object when not under pressure.
A gallery or raised apartment in a church, hall, etc.
definitions.example: an organ loft

definitions.definition: The pitch or slope of the face of a golf club (tending to drive the ball upward).
A floor or room placed above another.
To propel high into the air.
To fly or travel through the air, as though propelled
To throw the ball erroneously through the air instead of releasing it on the lane's surface.
To furnish with a loft space.
Lofty; proud; haughty
Designed to be suitable for any sex or gender.

definitions.definition: Not distinguished on the basis of sex or gender.
A writer of history; a chronicler; an annalist.
One who studies or researches history.
One who recounts their own medical history.
A small case, often flat and often made of leather, for keeping money (especially paper money), credit cards, etc.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A person's bank account or assets.
definitions.example: It's unknown if the pro running back's recent sex scandal will hit him in the wallet or not.

definitions.definition: A thick case or folder with plastic sleeves in which compact discs may be stored.
definitions.example: I won an auction online for a cheap CD wallet.

definitions.definition: A bag or pouch.

definitions.definition: A person's buttocks (the area of the body nearest where one keeps one's wallet).
definitions.example: He fell down and landed on his wallet.

definitions.definition: Capable of being distinguished and named.
definitions.example: I don't know where he was from because he had no identifiable accent.

definitions.definition: A tree of the genus Ulmus of the family Ulmaceae, large deciduous trees with alternate stipulate leaves and small apetalous flowers.
(usually attributive) Wood from an elm tree.
A copy or reproduction.
A fax, a machine for making and sending copies of printed material and images via radio or telephone network.
The image sent by the machine itself.
To send via a facsimile machine; to fax.
To make a copy of; to reproduce.
An emotional or psychological humiliation or bad experience.

definitions.definition: A bodily injury causing pain; a wound or bruise.
Injury; damage; detriment; harm
A roundel azure (blue circular spot).
A band on a trip-hammer helve, bearing the trunnions.
A husk.
To be painful.

definitions.definition: To cause (a creature) physical pain and/or injury.

definitions.definition: To cause (somebody) emotional pain.
To undermine, impede, or damage.

definitions.definition: A simple aliphatic alcohol formally derived from ethane by replacing one hydrogen atom with a hydroxyl group: CH3-CH2-OH.
Specifically, this alcohol as a fuel.
A tall annual dioecious plant (Cannabis, especially Cannabis sativa), native to central Asia and having alternate, palmately divided leaves and tough bast fibers.
A mildly euphoriant or sedating, intoxicating hallucinogenic drug prepared from various parts of this plant.
The purified and decarboxylated resin of the cannabis plant used for medicinal purposes rather than for any intoxicating effects.
To bend (any thin material, such as paper) over so that it comes in contact with itself.
To make the proper arrangement (in a thin material) by bending.

definitions.definition: To become folded; to form folds.
definitions.example: Cardboard doesn't fold very easily.

definitions.definition: To fall over; to be crushed.

definitions.definition: To enclose within folded arms (see also enfold).
To give way on a point or in an argument.
To withdraw from betting.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To withdraw or quit in general.
To stir gently, with a folding action.

definitions.definition: Of a company, to cease to trade.

definitions.definition: To double or lay together, as the arms or the hands.

definitions.definition: To cover or wrap up; to conceal.
To confine animals in a fold.
To reply to an invitation.

definitions.definition: To contain or embrace.

definitions.definition: To include, contain, or be made up of, defining the minimum elements, whether essential or inessential, to define an invention. ("Open-ended", doesn't limit to the items listed; cf. compose, which is "closed" and limits to the items listed.)

A dilute drink made from this syrup.
A thin gauzy fabric of silk or wool, used for women's clothing and men's woven luxury ties.
(formerly a trade name) A dyestuff consisting essentially of impure fuchsine.
Something that protrudes, sticks out, or sticks together; a cluster or blob; a mound or mass of no particular shape.

definitions.definition: A group, set, or unit.

definitions.definition: A small, shaped mass of sugar, typically about a teaspoonful.

definitions.definition: A dull or lazy person.

definitions.definition: (as plural) A beating or verbal abuse.

definitions.definition: A projection beneath the breech end of a gun barrel.
A kind of fish, the lumpsucker.
Food given to a tramp to be eaten on the road.
To treat as a single unit; to group together in a casual or chaotic manner (as if forming an ill-defined lump of the items).

definitions.definition: To bear a heavy or awkward burden; to carry something unwieldy from one place to another.
To hit or strike (a person).
(used with "of") To eliminate or to get rid of something.

definitions.definition: To distribute or arrange; to put in place.
To deal out; to assign to a use.
To incline.

definitions.definition: To bargain; to make terms.
To regulate; to adjust; to settle; to determine.

Textual versions of the dialog in films, usually displayed at the bottom of the screen.
To create subtitles for the dialog in a film.
A tree or shrub of the genus Castanea.
The nut of this tree or shrub.
A dark, reddish-brown colour, as seen on the fruit of the chestnut tree.
A reddish-brown horse.
The wood of a chestnut tree.
An old joke; a worn-out meme, phrase, ploy, etc. so often repeated as to have grown tiresome or ineffective (often in the phrase "old chestnut").

The horse-chestnut.
Of a deep reddish-brown colour, like that of a chestnut.
The keeper, manager of a library.
One who cares for the publications, files etc. in a library, whether staff or volunteer.
A person who processes and organizes information.
To carve text or symbols into (something), usually for the purposes of identification or art.

definitions.definition: To put in a grave, to bury.
Made by engraving
Decorated with engravings
To limp; move with a limping gait.

definitions.definition: Lameness; a limp.
Lame, limping.
Rose bengal dye worn by Indian women on the feet during festivals
A poem describing the life and manners of shepherds; a poem in which the speakers assume the character of shepherds; an idyll; a bucolic.

Relating to rural life and scenes

definitions.definition: Relating to the care of souls, to the pastor of a church or to any local religious leader charged with the service of individual parishioners, i.e. a priest or rabbi.

definitions.definition: Not paid for.

definitions.definition: Of work: done without agreed payment, usually voluntarily.

definitions.definition: The spirit; the soul of man.

definitions.definition: Any faint shadowy semblance; an unsubstantial image

An unwanted image similar to and overlapping or adjacent to the main one on a television screen, caused by the transmitted image being received both directly and via reflection.
A ghostwriter.

An image of a file or hard disk.
An understudy.

The faint image that remains after an attempt to remove graffiti.
An opponent in a racing game that follows a previously recorded route, allowing players to compete against previous best times.
A dead person whose identity is stolen by another. See ghosting.
(in names of species) White or pale.

definitions.definition: (in names of species) Transparent or translucent.

definitions.definition: Abandoned.

definitions.definition: Remnant; the remains of a(n).

definitions.definition: Perceived or listed but not real.

definitions.definition: Of cryptid, supernatural or extraterrestrial nature.

definitions.definition: Substitute.

To kill.

definitions.definition: To harbour suspicion about; suspect.

(grammar) a word that names a person, place, thing or idea; a noun (sensu stricto)
Part of a text that carries the meaning, such as words and their ordering.
(grammar) to make a word belonging to another part of speech into a substantive (that is, a noun) or use it as a noun
Of the essence or essential element of a thing; as, "substantive information"
Having substance; enduring; solid; firm; substantial
Applying to essential legal principles and rules of right; as, "substantive law"

Depending on itself; independent.
(grammar) used like a noun substantive
(of a rank or appointment) actually and legally held, as distinct from an acting, temporary or honorary rank or appointment
A short report, especially one released through official channels to be broadcast or publicized.

A short printed publication, especially one produced by an organization.
A strong feeling of anxiety.

definitions.definition: To harass; to irritate or distress.

definitions.definition: To seize or shake by the throat, especially of a dog or wolf.

definitions.definition: To touch repeatedly, to fiddle with.
To strangle.

Male.

Aerospace.

definitions.example: It is amazing that he has never buckled after so many years of doing such urgent work.

definitions.definition: To yield; to give way; to cease opposing.
To enter upon some labour or contest; to join in close fight; to contend.
To buckle down; to apply oneself.
To fasten using a buckle.
To unite in marriage.
A clasp used for fastening two things together, such as the ends of a belt, or for retaining the end of a strap.
The brisure of an eighth daughter.
(roofing) An upward, elongated displacement of a roof membrane frequently occurring over insulation or deck joints. A buckle may be an indication of movement with the roof assembly.
A distortion, bulge, bend, or kink, as in a saw blade or a plate of sheet metal.
A curl of hair, especially a kind of crisp curl formerly worn; also, the state of being curled.
A contorted expression, as of the face.
An act of fetching, of bringing something from a distance.
The object of fetching; the source of an attraction; a force, propensity, or quality which attracts.
A stratagem or trick; an artifice.
(originally Ireland) The apparition of a living person; a person's double, the sight of which is supposedly a sign that they are fated to die soon, a doppelganger; a wraith.
To retrieve; to bear towards; to go and get.
To obtain as price or equivalent; to sell for.
definitions.example: If you put some new tyres on it, and clean it up a bit, the car should fetch about $5,000

definitions.definition: To bring or get within reach by going; to reach; to arrive at; to attain; to reach by sailing.
definitions.example: to fetch headway or sternway

definitions.definition: To bring oneself; to make headway; to veer; as, to fetch about; to fetch to windward.
To take (a breath), to heave (a sigh)
To cause to come; to bring to a particular state.
To recall from a swoon; to revive; sometimes with to.
definitions.example: to fetch a man to

definitions.definition: To reduce; to throw.
To bring to accomplishment; to achieve; to make; to perform, with certain objects.
definitions.example: to fetch a compass;  to fetch a leap

definitions.definition: To make (a pump) draw water by pouring water into the top and working the handle.
A room or area for preparing food.
Cuisine.
The nape of a person's hairline, often referring to its uncombed or "nappy" look.
The percussion section of an orchestra.
A utensil for roasting meat.
A domesticated or uneducated form of a language.
A public gaming room in a casino.
Anything eaten as a relish with bread, potatoes, etc.
To do kitchen work; to prepare food.
To embellish a basic food; to season, add condiments, etc.
(by extension) To embellish; to dress up.
An atom or group of atoms bearing an electrical charge, such as the sodium and chlorine atoms in a salt solution.
The anus.
A jerk; an inappropriately or objectionably mean, inconsiderate, contemptible, obnoxious, intrusive, stupid, and/or rude person.
An unpleasant or uninviting place.
By extension, anything unpleasant or undesirable. Often used appositionally.
A receptacle under a fire grate for collecting ashes.
A Buddhist temple in Southeast Asia.
definitions.example: Angkor Wat

definitions.definition: A kind of stew or curry eaten in Ethiopia and Eritrea.
(Singlish) Used to contradict an underlying assumption held by the interlocutor.
(usually followed by "with," but also sometimes "would" or "might," especially in finance) In some manner or degree; in part; partly. See also what with
definitions.example: The market will calculate these higher risks in their funding costs what might result in higher lending rates.

definitions.definition: Such.
definitions.example: What a beautiful day!

definitions.definition: Why.
Used to introduce each of two coordinate phrases or concepts; both…and.
(Singlish) Used to contradict an underlying assumption held by the interlocutor.
(interrogative) Which thing, event, circumstance, etc.: used interrogatively in asking for the specification of an identity, quantity, quality, etc.
That which; those that; the thing that.
definitions.example: He knows what he wants.

definitions.definition: (relative) That; which; who.
Whatever.
definitions.example: I will do what I can to help you.

definitions.definition: Someone who dives, especially as a sport.
Someone who works underwater; a frogman.
The loon (bird).
The New Zealand sand diver.
The long-finned sand diver.
A passenger carrying vehicle using an underground route; specially, a diver tram, one using the former Kingsway tramway subway (1906-1952).
A pickpocket.
A competitor in certain sports who is known to regularly imitate being fouled, with the purpose of getting his/her opponent penalised.
Consisting of many different elements; various.
Different; dissimilar; distinct; not the same
Capable of various forms; multiform.

Composed of people with a variety of different demographic characteristics in terms of, for example, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, etc., and having a sizeable representation of people that are minorities in a given area.
Belonging to a minority group.
definitions.example: Idris Elba was a diverse hire for the franchise

definitions.definition: A form of motorcycle racing on flat (without camber) oval dirt tracks using motorcycles with neither brakes nor gears.
A form of bicycle racing on flat (non-banked) oval dirt tracks.
A racetrack venue designated especially for the sport of auto racing.
A road for high speed traffic; an expressway.
One who founds or establishes (especially said of a company, project, organisation, state)
definitions.example: the founder of Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg

definitions.definition: Someone for whose parents one has no data.
The iron worker in charge of the blast furnace and the smelting operation.
One who casts metals in various forms; a caster.
definitions.example: a founder of cannon, bells, hardware, or printing types

definitions.definition: A severe laminitis of a horse, caused by untreated internal inflammation in the hooves.
Of a ship, to fill with water and sink.
To fall; to stumble and go lame, as a horse.
To fail; to miscarry.
To cause to fill and sink, as a ship.
To disable or lame (a horse) by causing internal inflammation and soreness in the feet or limbs.
A loose shirt, usually made of a knit fleece, for athletic wear and now often used as casual apparel.
A shirt worn against the skin, usually under other clothing, to absorb sweat.
The highest or uppermost side or portion of something
A favourable aspect of something that also has an unfavourable aspect
An upward tendency, especially in a financial market etc
On the top of.
A naval officer of the highest rank; the commander of a country's naval forces.
A naval officer of high rank, immediately below Admiral of the Fleet; the commander of a fleet or squadron.

A flag officer in the United States Navy or Coast Guard of a grade superior to vice admiral and junior to admiral of the fleet (when that grade is used). An admiral is equal in grade or rank to a four-star general.
The ship which carries the admiral, the flagship; also, the most considerable ship of a fleet.
A prince or Saracen leader under the Sultan.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genera Kaniska and Vanessa, especially a red admiral or white admiral.
An expression of happiness.
definitions.example: Yay! I have finally finished my work!

definitions.definition: Yes.
Thus, so (now often accompanied by a hand gesture).
definitions.example: The pony was yea high.

definitions.definition: The letter for the y sound in Pitman shorthand.
Cocaine (powder or crack).
One who protects or supports; a defender or advocate.
An influential, wealthy person who supported an artist, craftsman, a scholar or a noble.
A customer, as of a certain store or restaurant.
definitions.example: This car park is for patrons only.

definitions.definition: (Roman law) A protector of a dependent, especially a master who had freed a slave but still retained some paternal rights.
One who has gift and disposition of a benefice.
A padrone.
A property owner, a landlord, a master. (Compare patroon.)
To be a patron of; to patronize; to favour.
To treat as a patron.
A dish or foodstuff where two or more slices of bread serve as the wrapper or container of some other food.
(by extension) Any combination formed by layering one type of material between two layers of some other material.
A layer cake or sandwich cake.
To place one item between two other, usually flat, items
To put or set something between two others, in time.
A person who boils something.
A steam boiler.
An apparatus for heating circulating water or other heat transferring liquid.
A device consisting of a heat source and a tank for storing hot water, typically for space heating, domestic hot water etc., disregarding the source of heat.
A kitchen vessel for steaming, boiling or heating food.
A sunken reef, especially a coral reef, on which the sea breaks heavily.
A tough old chicken only suitable for cooking by boiling.
Boilerplate.
To act before (someone), especially to prevent an action.
To take up or introduce (something) prematurely.
definitions.example: The advocate plans to anticipate a part of her argument.

definitions.definition: To know of (something) before it happens; to expect.
definitions.example: Please anticipate a journey of an hour from your house to the airport

definitions.definition: To eagerly wait for (something)
definitions.example: Little Johnny started to anticipate the arrival of Santa Claus a week before Christmas.

definitions.definition: A combination of a user's identification and password used to enter a computer.
definitions.example: Using the same logon for different systems can be a security risk.

definitions.definition: The process of logging on.
definitions.example: The user's desktop is displayed shortly after logon.

definitions.definition: To lead by persuasion or influence; incite or prevail upon.
To cause, bring about, lead to.
definitions.example: His meditation induced a compromise.   Opium induces sleep.

definitions.definition: To cause or produce (electric current or a magnetic state) by a physical process of induction.
To infer by induction.
To lead in, bring in, introduce.
To draw on, place upon.
To stuff.
To furnish with a pad or padding.
To increase the size of, especially by adding undesirable filler.
definitions.example: May 21, 2008, Austin American-Statesman

definitions.definition: To imbue uniformly with a mordant.
definitions.example: to pad cloth

definitions.definition: To deliberately play the ball with the leg pad instead of the bat.
To travel along (a road, path etc.).
To travel on foot.
To wear a path by walking.
To walk softly, quietly or steadily, especially without shoes.
To practise highway robbery.
Soft filling material used in cushions etc.
Extra characters such as spaces added to a record to fill it out to a fixed length.
Extraneous text added to a message for the purpose of concealing its beginning, ending, or length.
Anything of little value used to fill up space.
definitions.example: That magazine is mostly advertisements; the rest is padding.

definitions.definition: Agent noun of recruit; one who recruits, particularly one employed to recruit others.
definitions.example: The army recruiter promised that I'd see the world and learn useful skills if I enlisted.
